Banyak Muncul Desa Fiktif demi Dana Desa, Pemerintah Lakukan Penyelidikan
07 Nov 2019, 05:41 by Yusuf Wijanarko
JAKARTA, (PR).- Pemerintah menyelidiki kabar dugaan desa fiktif terkait pemberian dana desa. Hasil penyelidikan akan diteruskan kepada Menteri Sekretaris Negara Pratikno untuk ditindaklanjuti.
"Kami tim komunikasi kepresidenan juga tengah mengumpulkan informasi-informasi tentang apa yang berkembang. Ada yang mengatakan dari 70.400 desa itu, ada dana yang tidak sampai atau ada desa yang tidak ada," kata Juru Bicara Kepresidenan, Fadjroel Rachman di Istana Negara, Jakarta, Kamis 7 November 2019.
Menurut Fadjroel Rachman, laporan beberapa kementerian yakni Kementerian Keuangan serta Kementerian Desa Pembangunan Daerah Tertinggal dan Transmigrasi menjelaskan dugaan desa fiktif tersebut. "Kami kumpulkan data, apakah nyata ada di lapangan," ujar dia kepada Antara.
Sebelumnya, Menteri Keuangan Sri Mulyani Indrawati mengungkapkan kemunculan desa-desa baru sebagai imbas adanya kucuran dana desa.
Sri Mulyani, di depan anggota Komisi XI DPR, Jakarta, Senin 4 November 2019 mengungkapkan, ada laporan banyak desa baru tak berpenduduk yang dibentuk agar bisa mendapat kucuran dana desa secara rutin setiap tahun.
"Kami mendengar beberapa masukan karena adanya transfer ajeg dari APBN sehingga sekarang muncul desa-desa baru yang bahkan tidak ada penduduknya, hanya untuk bisa mendapatkan (dana desa)," ujar Sri Mulyani.
Sementara itu, KPK membantu Kepolisian Daerah Sulawesi Tenggara menangani dugaan kasus korupsi dana desa fiktif.
Perkara yang ditangani tersebut adalah dugaan tindak pidana korupsi membentuk atau mendefinitifkan desa-desa yang tidak sesuai prosedur dengan menggunakan dokumen yang tidak sah.
Menurut Juru Bicara KPK Febri Diansyah, hal itu diduga mengakibatkan kerugian keuangan negara atau daerah atas Dana Desa dan Alokasi Dana Desa yang dikelola beberapa desa di Kabupaten Konawe Tahun Anggaran 2016 sampai dengan Tahun Anggaran 2018.
Dalam perkara tersebut, diduga ada 34 desa yang bermasalah dengan rincian tiga desa di antaranya fiktif sedangkan 31 desa lainnya ada tetapi surat keputusan pembentukannya dibuat dengan tanggal mundur.***

Many Fictitious Villages Appear for Village Funds, Government Conducts Investigations
Nov 7 2019, 5:41 p.m. by Yusuf Wijanarko
JAKARTA, (PR) .- The government is investigating news of alleged fictitious villages related to village funding. The results of the investigation will be forwarded to the Minister of State Secretary Pratikno for further action.
"Our presidential communication team is also gathering information about what is developing. Some say that of the 70,400 villages, there are funds that are not reaching or there are no villages," said Presidential Spokesperson, Fadjroel Rachman at the State Palace, Jakarta, Thursday 7 November 2019.
According to Fadjroel Rachman, reports from several ministries, namely the Ministry of Finance and the Ministry of Rural Development and Transmigration Villages explained the alleged fictional village. "We are collecting data, is it real in the field," he told Antara.
Previously, Minister of Finance Sri Mulyani Indrawati revealed the emergence of new villages as the impact of village funding.
Sri Mulyani, in front of House Commission XI members, Jakarta, Monday 4 November 2019 revealed, there were reports that many new uninhabited villages had been formed so that they could receive village funds regularly every year.
"We heard some input because of the steady transfer from the APBN so that now new villages are emerging that don't even have residents, just to be able to get (village funds)," Sri Mulyani said.
Meanwhile, the KPK is helping the Southeast Sulawesi Regional Police handle alleged corruption cases of fictitious village funds.
The case handled was the alleged corruption act of forming or defining villages that were not in accordance with procedures by using illegal documents.
According to KPK Spokesman Febri Diansyah, it was allegedly resulting in state or regional financial losses on the Village Fund and the Village Fund Allocation that was managed by several villages in Konawe Regency in the 2016 Fiscal Year to 2018 Fiscal Year.
In this case, it is suspected that there were 34 villages that had problems with the details of three villages including fictitious ones while 31 other villages existed but the decree for the establishment was made with a date of withdrawal. ***
